bs

Class Connection

  • java.lang.Object
    • bs.Connection
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    StreamConnection

    public abstract class Connection
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages a particular type of connection to a remote device.

    • Field Summary

        public Connection(MessageReceiver receiver)

    • Method Detail

      • notifyMessageReceiver

        protected void notifyMessageReceiver(Message m)
        Notifies all message receivers that a message has been received. The individual receivers then process the message in their own way
        Parameters:
        m - The message that has been received
        See Also:
        bs.MessageReceiver.receiveMessage

      • notifyConnectionEstablished

        protected void notifyConnectionEstablished()
        Notifies all connection state listeners that a connection has been established. The individual listeners then perform their specified actions to take upon establishing a connection.
        See Also:
        bs.ConnectionStateListener.connectionEstablished

      • notifyConnectionLost

        protected void notifyConnectionLost()
        Notifies all connection state listeners that a connection has been lost. The individual listeners then perform their specified actions to take upon loosing a connection.
        See Also:
        bs.ConnectionStateListener.connectionLost

      • notifyConnecting

        protected void notifyConnecting()
        Notifies all connection state listeners that a connection has been initiated, but has not been established yet. The individual listeners then perform their specified actions to take when waiting for a connection.
        See Also:
        bs.ConnectionStateListener.connecting

      • notifyConnectionAttemptFailed

        protected void notifyConnectionAttemptFailed()
        Notifies all connection state listeners that an attempt to connect failed. The individual listeners then perform their specified actions to take upon failing to establish a connection.
        See Also:
        bs.ConnectionStateListener.connectionAttemptFailed();

      • isConnected

        public abstract boolean isConnected()

      • connect

        public abstract void connect(java.lang.String name,
           java.lang.String address)
        Tries to initiate a connection to a device with the given name and address. Note that this is an asynchronous operation. Use a ConnectionStateListener to detect when a connection is established. If the system is currently connected or trying to connect when this method is called, the existing connection or connection attempt will be terminated.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the device to connect to
        address - The address of the device to connect to

      • disconnect

        public abstract void disconnect()
        Terminates any existing connection and halts any current attempt to establish a connection.

      • sendMessage

        public abstract boolean sendMessage(Message m)
        If connected, sends a message over the connection. Otherwise, does nothing.
        Parameters:
        m - The message to send
        Returns:
        True if able to successfully send the message, false otherwise

      • addMessageReceiver

        public void addMessageReceiver(MessageReceiver receiver)
        Registers the given MessageReceiver callback
        Parameters:
        receiver - The callback

      • addConnectionStateListener

        public void addConnectionStateListener(ConnectionStateListener listener)
        Registers the given ConnectionStateListener callback
        Parameters:
        listener - The callback to notify of changes in connection state
